subject: Your daily e-mail from the BBC
body:
Saturday, 02 June, 2007, 18:00 GMT 14:00 -04:00:Canada/Eastern














Search BBC Sport 













FOOTBALL




Wales 0-0 Czech Republic
Ryan Giggs ends his international career as Wales hold the Czech Republic in Cardiff.



 
Wales future looks bright - Giggs
Wales captain Ryan Giggs retires from internationals hailing the draw with the Czech Republic as 'a benchmark performance'.



 
Toshack must resign says Savage
Ex-Wales player Robbie Savage renews his attack on boss John Toshack by branding the national set-up an 'utter shambles'.








GOLF




Dredge senses home Wales Open win
Wales' Bradley Dredge goes into the final round of the Welsh Open tied for the lead with Martin Kaymer.



 
Wales Open leaderboard
The European Tour event at Celtic Manor enters its second round.



 
Scott surges through at Memorial
Australian Adam Scott seizes the halfway lead in the Memorial Tournament in Ohio after a 10-under 62.








MOTORSPORT




Stoner claims pole at Italian GP
Championship leader Casey Stoner will start on pole for the Italian MotoGP at Mugello.



 
Rally of Greece latest standings
Marcus Gronholm and Sebastien Loeb rejoin their world title battle in Greece's historic Acropolis Rally.



 
Opening TT action is called off
Saturday's programme at the Isle of Man TT is abandoned because of bad weather.








FORMULA ONE




Valencia secures F1 street race
Valencia signs its contract to  host a Grand Prix around the Spanish city's streets from 2008.



 
McLaren cleared over Hamilton row
McLaren are cleared of any wrongdoing after an investigation into whether they illegally used team orders in the Monaco Grand Prix.



 
Stewart backs McLaren on Hamilton
F1 great Sir Jackie Stewart says McLaren did the right thing in asking Fernando Alonso and Lewis Hamilton not to race in Monaco.








ATHLETICS




Brit sprinters to meet in Glasgow
Mark Lewis-Francis, Jason Gardener and Craig Pickering will clash in the 100 metres at Sunday's Glasgow Grand Prix.



 
Radcliffe contract still unsigned
Paula Radcliffe has still not signed a central contract with UK Athletics, even though the deadline expired almost a year ago.



 
Clegg set for 'special' home race
Scottish Paralympic sprinter Libby Clegg aims to shine in Sunday's Norwich Union Glasgow Grand Prix.








CYCLING




Di Luca has sights on Giro prize
Italy's Paolo Savoldelli wins the 20th stage of the Giro d'Italia, leaving Danilo di Luca almost certain to take the overall victory.



 
Thomas toasts 'dream' Tour place
Wales's Geraint Thomas is celebrating a "dream come true" as he prepares to ride in the Tour de France next month.



 
Mayo breakaway secures stage win
Spaniard Iban Mayo wins the 19th stage of the Giro d'Italia in heavy rain in Terme di Comano.








FUN AND GAMES




Splash the cash
Robbo dreams of being a footballing millionaire



 
Ten to Tackle
Test your knowledge of the last seven days in sport



 
Review of the week
Kieran Richardson's cousin on Big Brother as Ronaldo's mum spits feathers
